seriesJson.title: Senate hearings on public broadcasting
seriesJson.description: Senate Hearings on Public Broadcasting Act of 1967, held during April 1967.

node.title: Educational radio, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, features Jerrold Sandler, executive director of National Educational Radio; and William Harley, president, National Association of Educational Broadcasters.

subject.name: United States. Congress. Senate. S. hrg.

node.title: Educational radio, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, features Jerrold Sandler, executive director of National Educational Radio; and William Harley, president, National Association of Educational Broadcasters.

subject.name: United States. Congress. Senate. S. hrg.

node.title: Ford Foundation, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents Fred Friendly, former president of CBS News, now advisor to the Ford Foundation.

subject.name: United States. Congress. Senate. S. hrg.

node.title: Educational television, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, features John F. White, president of National Educational Television (NET), and former Federal Communications Commission (FCC) chair E. William Henry. Also: Edwin Burrows; Jack McBride; and Newton Minow.

subject.name: United States. Congress. Senate. S. hrg.

node.title: Ford Foundation, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents Fred Friendly, former president of CBS News, now advisor to the Ford Foundation.

subject.name: United States. Congress. Senate. S. hrg.

node.title: Educational television, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, features John F. White, president of National Educational Television (NET), and former Federal Communications Commission (FCC) chair E. William Henry. Also: Edwin Burrows; Jack McBride; and Newton Minow.

subject.name: United States. Congress. Senate. S. hrg.

node.title: Government witnesses, part one
node.description: This program, part one of two, features Senator John Pastore (D-Rhode Island); Hugh Scott (R-Pennsylvania); Robert Griffin (R-Michigan); Vance Hartke (D-Indiana); Philip Hart (D-Michigan); Russell Long (D-La.); and Frank Moss (D-Utah).

subject.name: United States. Congress. Senate. S. hrg.

node.title: Carnegie Commission, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, features Dr. James R. Killian, Jr., chairman of Carnegie Commission, speaking on educational television.

subject.name: United States. Congress. Senate. S. hrg.

node.title: Government witnesses, part two
node.description: This program, part two of two, features Senator John Pastore (D-Rhode Island); Hugh Scott (R-Pennsylvania); Robert Griffin (R-Michigan); Vance Hartke (D-Indiana); Philip Hart (D-Michigan); Russell Long (D-La.); and Frank Moss (D-Utah).

subject.name: United States. Congress. Senate. S. hrg.

node.title: Carnegie Commission, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, features Dr. James R. Killian, Jr., chairman of Carnegie Commission, speaking on educational television.

subject.name: United States. Congress. Senate. S. hrg.
